meanings.definition: Happening or done at an inappropriate or unsuitable time.
meanings.sent1: The mistimed alarm woke me up too early.
meanings.sent2: The mistimed meeting caused confusion among the team.
meanings.sent3: The mistimed joke made everyone laugh at the wrong moment.
meanings.sent4: Her mistimed arrival at the party disrupted the surprise.
meanings.sent5: The mistimed fireworks display startled the sleeping neighborhood.

meanings.sent1: I mistimed my jump and fell off the swing.
meanings.sent2: She mistimed her speech and missed the applause.
meanings.sent3: He mistimed the punchline, making the joke fall flat.
meanings.sent4: The pianist mistimed the final note, ending the concert abruptly.
meanings.sent5: They mistimed the release of the product, missing the peak sales season.
